title: Salvage system and crafting materials
description: Salvage NPC breaks down items into materials: Normal->Scrap, Magic->Essence, Rare->Crystal, Unique->Prism. Materials stored in separate inventory tab. Crafting recipes: reroll affixes (Crystals), upgrade rarity (Essences->Crystals), add socket (Prism). Gem system: 6 types (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald/Topaz/Diamond/Onyx) with fixed bonuses, droppable, removable for gold.

title: Wave spawning system with formations
description: Enemies spawn in designed formations: Column (single file, pierce opportunity), Pincer (two groups from opposite sides), Surround (ring closing in), Shield wall (tanks in front, snipers behind), Chaotic swarm (many from all directions). Wave system progresses through formations with increasing difficulty. See GDD.md Wave Design.

title: Chat system with channels
description: Persistent chat panel at bottom of screen. Supabase Realtime Broadcast channels: General, Trading, LFG. Item linking in chat (hover preview). Click name to whisper. Right-click for trade request. Report/mute moderation. Chat history loaded on connect. See GDD.md Chat Channels.

title: Zone themes (3-4 initial)
description: Implement 3-4 zone themes with distinct palettes: The Grid (dark+cyan, basic mix), Neon Wastes (purple/magenta, swarms+flankers), Reactor Core (orange/red, fire enemies, burning ground), Frozen Array (blue/white, slow zones, cold enemies). Each theme sets background, grid tint, particle effects, enemy composition.

title: M5: Polish & Content
description: Remaining zone themes (5-8), more enemies/bosses, unique items (8-12), SFX/music, minimap, VFX polish, balance pass, remaining skills, colorblind mode, pixel art Phase 2. See GDD.md Milestone 5.

title: M7: Mobile Trade Companion
description: Lightweight responsive web UI for chat + trade from phone/tablet. Same Supabase auth, no canvas. Chat channels, item linking, inventory browsing, trade negotiation, push notifications for offers/whispers. Keeps players engaged between PC sessions. See GDD.md M7 + Platform Strategy.

title: M6: Social Layer
description: Supabase backend (auth, database), item registry + server validation, chat channels (General, Trading, LFG), item linking in chat, trade window, report/mute moderation, leaderboards, cloud save sync. See GDD.md Milestone 6.

title: Mouse-aim projectile attack
description: Player fires projectiles toward mouse cursor on click/hold. Projectiles are glowing circles that travel in a straight line and despawn off-screen or on hit. Use object pool for projectile recycling. Add to miniplex ECS with position, velocity, damage components. Basic collision detection (spatial hash or distance check).
notes:
## prepared.prompt

## Context
Ranged combat is the core gameplay. Projectile feel (speed, visual, impact) sets the tone for everything.

## Task
Implement mouse-aim projectile attack.

1. On mouse click (or hold), fire projectile toward cursor from player position
2. Projectiles: small glowing circles, travel in straight line
3. Despawn on: hitting enemy, hitting wall, or leaving screen bounds
4. Use object pool (src/pools/Pool.ts) - pre-allocate ~100 projectiles, recycle on despawn
5. Add to miniplex ECS with position, velocity, damage components
6. Collision detection: spatial hash or simple distance check against enemies
7. On hit: deal damage to enemy, small flash effect on impact
8. Fire rate: ~3-4 shots per second base

## Key Files
- src/entities/Projectile.ts
- src/pools/Pool.ts
- src/ecs/systems/ProjectileSystem.ts
- src/ecs/systems/CollisionSystem.ts

## When Done
Close issue: bd close pixeloot-3cm --reason='Projectile attack with object pooling, collision detection, hit effects'

title: Health bar, death, and respawn
description: Player has health bar (red bar on HUD). Takes damage from enemy contact. Death triggers screen flash + respawn at room center after 1s delay. Display damage numbers as floating text. Health potion placeholder (press Q, 8s cooldown, heals 30% over 2s as HoT).
notes:
## prepared.prompt

## Context
Health/death is the core tension loop. Without stakes, combat has no meaning.

## Task
Implement health bar, damage, death, and respawn.

1. Player health bar on HUD (red bar, top-left under FPS)
2. Player takes damage from enemy contact (brief invulnerability after hit, ~0.5s)
3. Floating damage numbers on hit (rise and fade)
4. Death: screen flash (white overlay, fade), respawn at room center after 1s
5. Lose 5-10% gold on death (placeholder gold counter)
6. Health potion: press Q, 8s cooldown, heals 30% max HP over 2s (HoT tick)
7. Potion cooldown indicator on HUD
8. Enemy health bars (small, above enemy, only when damaged)

## Key Files
- src/ui/HUD.ts
- src/ecs/systems/HealthSystem.ts
- src/ecs/systems/DamageSystem.ts
- src/entities/Player.ts (extend with health)

## When Done
Close issue: bd close pixeloot-3hc --reason='Health bars, damage numbers, death/respawn, health potion HoT'

title: Save/load system with Dexie.js
description: Dexie.js IndexedDB with schema versioning. Object stores: saves (metadata), playerState (inventory, stats, skills, level), worldState (map progress, stash). Auto-save on town entry and map clear. Manual save button. Load on game start. Export/import as JSON backup. See TECH-REFERENCE.md Dexie section.

title: 4-5 enemy types with different behaviors
description: Add enemy types beyond Rusher: Swarm (small orange circles, moves in packs), Tank (large green hexagon, slow, high HP, body-blocks), Sniper (magenta diamond, stays at range, fires projectiles), Flanker (yellow crescent, fast, circles behind player). Each has distinct shape + color per GDD.md Enemy Behaviors table.

title: Vendor NPC buy/sell
description: Vendor NPC in town sells basic Normal/Magic gear scaled to player level, skill books (rotating stock), and basic maps. Player can sell any item for gold based on rarity tier. Vendor UI: grid of items for sale, player inventory below, gold display. Simple shop panel.

title: Experience, leveling, and stat allocation
description: XP from killing enemies (scaled to enemy tier). Level up with notification + stat points. 4 stats: Dexterity (proj speed, attack speed), Intelligence (skill dmg, AoE), Vitality (HP, regen), Focus (mana, CDR). Stat allocation UI panel. Respec costs gold (gold sink). Display level + XP bar on HUD.

title: M4: Progression & Maps
description: XP/leveling, stat allocation, monster scaling formula, map items with modifiers, map device, 3-4 zone themes, town hub with NPCs, stash, crafting recipes, gem system, Dexie.js save/load. See GDD.md Milestone 4.

title: Item drop system with rarity tiers
description: Enemies drop items on death based on rarity table. Loot drops as glowing entities on ground (white/blue/yellow/orange glow per rarity). Pick up on click or walk-over. Drop rates influenced by map tier. Gold drops from all enemies. Items have the star burst shape from GDD color language.

title: Rusher enemy type that chases player
description: Create Rusher enemy: red triangle pointing at player, charges straight at player. Spawns at random positions outside viewport. Has health, deals contact damage. Dies with a small particle burst. Use miniplex ECS. Basic AI: move toward player position each frame.

title: Stat calculation from equipped gear
description: Aggregate stats from all 9 equipped gear slots + base character stats + stat point allocation. Apply to damage formula: (BaseWeaponDmg + FlatBonuses) * (1 + Sum%Bonuses). Apply defensive formulas: armor diminishing returns (Armor/(Armor+K)), resistance caps (75%), dodge cap (25%). Recalculate on equip/unequip. Display final stats in character panel.

title: M1: Walking Skeleton
description: First playable prototype. PixiJS v8 + Vite + TypeScript scaffold, player movement, mouse-aim shooting, one enemy type, health/death, procedural room, performance baseline. See GDD.md Milestone 1.

title: Boss encounter
description: Create first boss: large entity with white + multi-color glow, multi-phase fight. Phase 1: basic attack pattern. Phase 2: spawns adds (reinforcement wave). Phase 3: enrage (faster attacks, new abilities). Health bar displayed prominently. Spawns at end of wave sequence.

title: Scaffold Vite + TypeScript + PixiJS project
description: Initialize the project with: npm create vite@latest (vanilla-ts template), install pixi.js, pixi-filters, howler, rot-js, miniplex, dexie. Set up vite.config.ts with GitHub Pages base path, tsconfig.json for ES2022, src/ folder structure per GDD architecture. Add GitHub Actions deploy workflow. See TECH-REFERENCE.md for exact configs.
notes:
## prepared.prompt

## Context
This is the foundation everything else builds on. Get the project structure right and all future tasks have a clean starting point.

## Task
Scaffold the Pixeloot project with Vite + TypeScript + PixiJS v8.

1. Run: npm create vite@latest . -- --template vanilla-ts (or init in existing dir)
2. Install deps: pixi.js pixi-filters howler rot-js miniplex dexie
3. Install dev deps: @types/howler
4. Set up vite.config.ts (base: '/pixeloot/', target: es2022, assetsInlineLimit: 0, manual chunks for pixi+howler)
5. Set up tsconfig.json (target: ESNext, module: ESNext, moduleResolution: bundler, strict: true)
6. Create src/ folder structure per GDD architecture:
   src/main.ts, src/Game.ts, src/core/, src/ecs/, src/entities/, src/scenes/, src/map/, src/loot/, src/audio/, src/save/, src/ui/, src/online/, src/types/
7. Add .github/workflows/deploy.yml for GitHub Pages (see TECH-REFERENCE.md)
8. Verify npm run dev works and shows empty PixiJS canvas

## Key Files
- vite.config.ts
- tsconfig.json
- src/main.ts
- src/Game.ts
- TECH-REFERENCE.md (reference configs)

## When Done
Close issue: bd close pixeloot-8jl --reason='Project scaffolded with Vite+TS+PixiJS, folder structure created, dev server running'

title: Ranger class with 4 skills
description: Implement Ranger class with: Power Shot (charged arrow, pierces all in line), Multi Shot (fan of arrows in spread arc), Rain of Arrows (AoE circle after delay), Evasive Roll (dash with i-frames). Skills on hotbar slots 1-4 with cooldowns. Each skill has distinct projectile behavior. See GDD.md Ranger section.

title: Town hub with NPCs
description: Safe zone between maps. Vendor, Stash, Skill Trainer, Map Device, Salvage NPC. Player walks around town freely. NPC interaction via click. Town has distinct visual theme (safe, well-lit). Entry point from map completion, exit via map device.

title: Stash shared storage
description: Stash NPC in town provides shared storage grid. Multiple tabs (expandable, gold sink). Items persist across maps. Drag-and-drop between inventory and stash. Search/sort by type, rarity, affix.

title: Mage class with 4 skills
description: Implement Mage class with: Fireball (projectile + AoE splash on impact), Frost Nova (AoE ring around player, applies slow), Lightning Chain (bounces between nearby enemies), Teleport (blink to target location). Skills on hotbar slots 1-4 with cooldowns. See GDD.md Mage section.

title: Canvas renderer with dark background + grid

title: Leaderboards and cloud save
description: Leaderboard table with Supabase Postgres Changes subscription for realtime updates. Score submission with replay hash for verification. Cloud save sync: upload to Supabase on logout/checkpoint, download on login. Cross-device play.

title: Inventory UI with gear slots
description: 9-slot gear panel (helm, body, gloves, boots, ring x2, amulet, weapon, off-hand). Grid-based backpack for unequipped items. Click to equip/unequip. Hover shows item stats with affix rolls. Compare tooltip when hovering with item equipped in same slot. Rarity glow border on items. Dark panel UI style.

title: Supabase backend setup
description: Initialize Supabase project. Auth with anonymous sign-in + Discord OAuth upgrade. Database schema: players, inventory (jsonb attributes), trade_offers, leaderboard, chat_messages. RLS policies on all tables. Item registry table with server-generated IDs. See TECH-REFERENCE.md Supabase section.

title: Map items with modifiers and map device
description: Maps drop as items with random modifiers (Monsters +20% HP, Extra fast, Fire enchanted, Fire on death, Extra swarm, Boss +2 phases). Map tier determines quantity/rarity bonus. Map device NPC in town: insert map item to open portal. Higher tier = more modifiers stacked.

title: M2: Core Combat & Classes
description: Two ranged classes (Ranger + Mage) with 4 skills each, skill hotbar, 4-5 enemy types with behaviors, wave/formation spawning, health potion HoT, boss encounter, status effects framework. See GDD.md Milestone 2.

title: Skill hotbar UI
description: 4-slot skill hotbar at bottom of screen. Shows skill icons, cooldown overlays (sweep animation), keybind labels (1-4). Class selection at game start (Ranger or Mage). Skills are swappable from a skill menu (pick 4 from 6). Dark panel UI with neon accents.

title: Loot filter system
description: Toggle which item drops are displayed/highlighted on the ground. Filter by rarity (show/hide Normal, Magic, Rare, Unique) and by type (weapons, armor, jewelry). Settings persist. Keyboard shortcut to toggle filter. Filtered items still exist, just hidden visually.

title: Monster scaling formula
description: Implement: Monster Level = max(MapBaseLevel, PlayerLevel - 2) + MapTierBonus. Map base level prevents trivializing content. Player-2 keeps monsters slightly below (upgrades feel impactful). Tier bonus (+0 to +5) makes higher maps genuinely harder. Apply to monster HP, damage, and drop quality.

title: Item data model and affix generation
description: Define TypeScript interfaces for items: base item (slot, type, rarity, base stats), affixes (offensive/defensive/utility/conditional per GDD.md tables), unique effects. Implement affix roller: picks random affixes from pool, rolls values within tight ranges (30-50% variance). Rarity determines affix count (Normal=0, Magic=1-2, Rare=3-4). Conditional affixes are rare, only on Rare+ items.

title: Status effects framework
description: Implement status effect system per GDD.md: Slow (-30% move speed, 2s), Chill (-20% move/-15% attack, 3s), Burn (DoT, 3s), Shock (next hit +25% dmg, 4s), Stun (0.5s, 3s immunity after), Knockback (instant push), Mark (+15% dmg taken, 5s). Visual indicators on affected entities. Diminishing returns on stun. Bosses immune to stun, half-effective slow.

title: M3: Loot & Itemization
description: Item drops with rarity tiers, affix generation (standard + conditional), inventory UI with 9 gear slots, equip/compare, stat aggregation, weapon types with different projectiles, vendor NPC, loot filter, salvage + crafting materials. See GDD.md Milestone 3.

title: Trade window system
description: Trade request from chat (right-click player name). Trade window: both players place items + gold, both must confirm. Atomic server-side swap via Supabase RPC function. Server validates item ownership. Prevents duplication. See GDD.md Trading section.

title: Weapon types with different projectile behavior
description: 6 weapon types per GDD: Short Bow (fast, medium range), Long Bow (slow, long range, pierce), Crossbow (medium, knockback), Wand (fast, medium), Staff (slow, long, AoE bonus), Orb (medium, slight homing). Each changes projectile visual, speed, and behavior when equipped.
